labels.text: Appearance of Cross is one of the original paintings in Ding Yi’s experimentation with cross-shaped symbols. Characterised by intersecting straight lines running across the pale, greyish-blue surface, the systematic composition of Ding’s painting is minimal yet abstract. The painting rejects symbolic content and narrative meaning as defined by Western expressionism and abstraction. . Instead, the artist pursues an artistic purity and openness that is free of the perplexities and burdens of traditional Western theories. Through careful execution with a paintbrush, ruler, and tape, the ‘+’ motif is articulated in a structured and disciplined manner with precision. Appearance of Crossopens up an infinite process of construction, deconstruction and re-construction, to create a painting that is rich in texture while also oscillating between flatness and pictorial depth. The rationality of the work offers a wider and more objective approach for viewers to understand the structure of matters in contemporary society.

《十示》是丁乙以十字符號創作的實驗作品之一。淡灰藍色的表面上，直線縱橫交錯，形成作品的特色。構圖具規律美，既簡約又抽象。藝術家排斥西方表現主義和抽象主義所定下的象徵與敍述意涵，着意拋開傳統西方理論的艱澀與包袱，從而追求藝術上的純粹性與開放性。丁氏以畫筆、間尺和膠紙，在畫布上精確緊密地繪上十字圖案，展開了一個建構、解構與再建構的無盡過程。作品質感豐富，同時遊走於平面與深度之間。其理性特質讓觀者能以更開闊、更客觀的角度，了解當代社會中事物的結構。

images.AltText: Oil painting on canvas. Precise squares and rectangles in grey, yellow, steel blue, and black are separated by thin lines and resemble a tile mosaic of squares within squares.
images.AltTextTC: 油彩布本作品裏，多個精確的正方形和長方形圖案，呈灰、黃、鋼藍和黑色，並以纖幼的線條相隔。大小方格形成格中有格的圖紋，就如一幅瓷磚馬賽克。
